Description: Magical gem; intaglio; lapis lazuli; engraved on side A. Side A: Bes-Pantheos fragment: upper body of the deity with two pairs of wings and arms. Lower arms beside the body, upper arms holding standards and cobras, in the right hand: an axe, in the left hand: a scorpion, around the middle of the left arm: was-scepter. Face is masked, with four animal protomes on each side, on the head: atef-crown with sun disk, uraei and ram’s horns. To the left and right of the crown: eyes. Side B: Inscription in five lines.
Bibliographic references: Michel 2001 / Die Magischen Gemmen im Britischen Museum (160)
Bonner 1950 / Studies in magical amulets, chiefly Graeco-Egyptian
CBd / The Campbell Bonner Magical Gems Database Online (558) (http://classics.mfab.hu/talismans/cbd/558)
